intro: Wahlenbergia pygmaea subsp. pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a small flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. It is also known for its resilience to coastal conditions and salt spray.
